message.content: I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
What is the current broker version?
curl -X GET "http://localhost:1026/version"

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.

Retrieve the data of the building with ID urn:ngsi-ld:Building:farm001, using the @context as a Link header to define the entities returned, with ngsi-context.jsonld providing short names for every attribute.

curl -L -X GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:Building:farm001' \
-H 'Accept: application/ld+json' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Read the full context of the temperature sensor with ID urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:001 in normalized NGSI-LD format, including system attributes, with the @context in the header

curl --location 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:001?options=normalized' \
--header 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Obtain entity data Building using Fully Qualified Names

curl --location 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities?type=https%3A%2F%2Fsmartdatamodels.org%2FdataModel.Building%2FBuilding' \
--header 'Accept: application/ld+json'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Show the entity id store001 of Building type using concise form

curl --location 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:Building:store001?options=keyValues' \
--header 'Accept: application/ld+json'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Show the entity id store001 of Building type

curl --location 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:Building:store001' \
--header 'Accept: application/ld+json'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Give me a command to read the value of the temperature attribute from the temperature sensor with ID urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:002.

curl -G -iX GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:002' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-d 'attrs=temperature'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Give me a command to read the key-value pairs from the context of the temperature sensor with ID urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:001.

curl -G -iX GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:001' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/json' \
-d 'options=keyValues'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Give me a command to read the values of the category and temperature attributes from the context of the temperature sensor with ID urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:001.

curl -G -iX GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:001' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/json' \
-d 'options=keyValues' \
-d 'attrs=category,temperature'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Obtain the location, temperatur and humidity of the temperature sensor number 2

curl -G -iX GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:2' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/json' \
-d 'attrs=location,humidity,temperature'

-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \

-d 'attrs=location,temperature'

curl -G -iX GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/urn:ngsi-ld:TemperatureSensor:005' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/json' \
-d 'options=keyValues' \

Give me a command to list the full context of all TemperatureSensor entities.

curl -G -iX GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-d 'type=TemperatureSensor'

I would like to know all the attributes of the person entity type.
curl -X GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/types/City'

I'd like to have a list of entities of type Person

curl -G -iX GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/' \ 
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel=""http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context""; type=""application/ld+json""' \
-d 'type=Person'

Get the population of the City whose name is Tokyo
curl -X GET "http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities?type=City&q=name==%22Tokyo%22&attrs=https://uri.etsi.org/ngsi-ld/default-context/population" -H "Accept: application/ld+json"

List all entities of type City.
curl -X GET "http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities?type=City"

List the entities of type animal
curl -X GET "http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities?type=Animal" -H  'type="application/ld+json"'

List all entities of type Person, using de default context
curl -X GET "http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities?type=Person" -H  'type="application/ld+json"'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
List all entities of type Person, using a user context in http://context/user-context.jsonld
curl -X GET "http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities?type=Person" -H  'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.

Give me a command to retrieve all Building entities, using a Link header to associate type="Building" with the FQN https://uri.fiware.org/ns/dataModels/Building, and returning the response in key-value format

curl -G -X GET \
    'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/ld+json' \
    -d 'type=Building' \
    -d 'options=keyValues'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.

Retrieve all Building entities where the name attribute is "Big Red Barn", using the q parameter for filtering. Ensure spaces in the string are URL-encoded, return the response in key-value format (options=keyValues), and use json-context.jsonld as the @context file.

curl -G -X GET \
  'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/json-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/ld+json' \
    -d 'type=Building' \
    -d 'q=name==%22Big%20Red%20Barn%22' \
    -d 'options=keyValues'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.

Give me a command to retrieve Building entities using an alternate @context file (alternate-context.jsonld), which maps attribute names to their German equivalents, allowing queries to use alternative short names (e.g., type=Gebäude instead of type=Building).

curl -G -X GET \
    'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/alternate-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/ld+json' \
    -d 'type=Geb%C3%A4ude' \
    -d 'q=name==%22Big%20Red%20Barn%22' \
    -d 'options=keyValues'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Retrieve all Building entities where the category attribute contains either "commercial" or "office", using the q parameter with comma-separated values for filtering.

curl -G -X GET \
    'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/user-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/ld+json' \
    -d 'type=Building' \
    -d 'q=category==%22barn%22,%22farm_auxiliary%22' \
    -d 'options=keyValues'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Fetch all Store entities located in the Tiergarten District as the sub attribute addressLocality

curl -G -X GET 'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities/' \
-H 'Link: <http://context/json-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
-H 'Accept: application/ld+json' \
    -d 'type=Building' \
    -d 'q=address%5BaddressLocality%5D==%22Tiergarten%22' \
    -d 'options=keyValues'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
I'd like to retrieve all Building entities with the metadata verified address.

curl -G -X GET \
    'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities' \
    -H 'Link: <http://context/json-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context; type="application/ld+json"' \
    -H 'Accept: application/json' \
    -d 'type=Building' \
    -d 'q=address.verified==true' \
    -d 'options=keyValues'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.

Fetch in concise format all Building entities within 800 meters of the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin (52.5162N, 13.3777W), using a geo-query with the parameters geometry, coordinates, and georel. Use json-context.jsonld found in context as the @context file.

curl -G -X GET \
  'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities' \
  -H 'Link: <http://context/json-context.jsonld>; rel="http://www.w3.org/ns/json-ld#context"; type="application/ld+json"' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -d 'type=Building' \
  -d 'geometry=Point' \
  -d 'coordinates=%5B13.3777,52.5162%5D' \
  -d 'georel=near%3BmaxDistance==800' \
  -d 'options=keyValues'

  -d 'type=Building' \

  -d 'coordinates=%5B13.3777,52.5162%5D' \
  -d 'georel=near%3BmaxDistance==800'

Retrieve all the parkings with distance of at least 1 kilometer from the Berlin Wall (52.535152N, 13.390206W) using the context found in localhost json-context.jsonld as a context file

curl -G -X GET \
  'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities' \
  -H 'type="application/ld+json"' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -d 'type=Parking' \
  -d 'geometry=Point' \
  -d 'coordinates=%5B13.390206,52.535152%5D' \
  -d 'georel=near%3BminDistance==1000' -H 'Link:<http://localhost/json-context.jsonld>'

I need you to act as an expert in NGSI-LD with a background on semantic modeling and Smart Data Models (SDM). I will then send you some queries in Natural Language and you should convert them into NGSI-LD fully executable code to run in a FIWARE system (a Context Broker). Assume you are connected to a context broker in localhost and port 1026 and that your answers will be directly forwarded to the context broker; so send only the set of commands that would be sent to the CB, no explanation at all unless requested.
Retrieve all the stores with distance of at least 2 kilometers from the Berlin Wall (52.535152N, 13.390206W) using the default context , in canonical format

curl -G -X GET \
  'http://localhost:1026/ngsi-ld/v1/entities' \
  -H 'type="application/ld+json"' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -d 'type=Store' \
  -d 'geometry=Point' \
  -d 'coordinates=%5B13.390206,52.535152%5D' \
  -d 'georel=near%3BminDistance==2000'
